title: Mourning Google
notes: A behind the scenes look at how business wankers are killing Google.

title: Hippy, capitalist, guru, grocer: the forgotten genius who changed British food
notes: Saunders was obsessed with documenting how the new global counterculture was changing the ancient city around him. In 1970, at the age of 32, he self-published his findings in a slim but dense guidebook called Alternative London. The book was testament to Saundersâ€™ belief that information should be made available to all, and that this information should be rigorously tested.

title: Progressively Enhancing a Table with a Web Component
notes: A guide to building a web component to wrap around an existing table to add sort functionality.

title: Sortable Table Columns
notes: Practical guidance on creating an accessible sortable table, with testing.

title: Varyag degrees of success
notes: To lose a ship once, as Wilde nearly suggested, may be regarded as misfortune. To lose the same ship twice begins to look like carelessness...

title: A Call for Consensus on HTML Semantics
notes: HTML semantics are a good thing to use but Stephanie points out that it isn't always clear how best to use even basic HTML.

title: 'I just went bent': how Britain's most corrupt cop ruined countless lives
notes: A corrupt policeman but the institution and leaders that allowed it to happen are still in place.

title: Email vs Capitalism, or, Why We Can't Have Nice Things - NDC Oslo 2023
notes: A brilliant talk about email, how it works and how much we rely on an unreliable system.
